name: src/Parser.js
Parser
description: Parser - Receives any strategy and safely implement it

params.name: strategy
params.description: Any strategy implementing the Base's prototype

name: parse
description: Parser.prototype.parse - Exposes the parsing from string to any valid JS type with the strategy

name: stringify
description: Parser.prototype.stringify - Exposes the stringify() method from any valid JS type to expected type with the strategy

name: valid
description: Parser.prototype.valid - Exposes the valid() method from strategy. Checks if given data is valid

name: pipeStringify
description: Parser.prototype.pipeStringify - Exposes the pipeStringify() method from strategy. Streams data through stringify

name: pipeParse
description: Parser.prototype.pipeParse - Exposes the pipeParse() method from strategy. Streams data through parse

name: src/errors/NotImplemented.js
NotImplemented
description: NotImplemented

name: src/errors/ParserError.js
content:
/**
 * ParseError
 *
 * @param {string} format - which format the error ocurred
 * @param {object} context - any context info for debugging
 */
function ParseError (format, context = {}) {
  this.name = 'ParseError'
  this.message = `Failed to parse ${format}`
  this.context = context
}

ParseError.prototype = new Error()

module.exports = ParseError

name: ParseError
description: ParseError

params.name: format
params.description: which format the error ocurred

params.name: context
params.description: any context info for debugging

name: src/index.js
src/strategies/Base.js
Base
description:
Base class for strategies around the Parser
Every function that haven't been implemented
will throw an NotImplementedError

name: stringify
description: Base.prototype.stringify - receives * form of data and turns it into a string

name: parse
description: Base.prototype.parse - receives an string and translate it to valid JavaScript

name: pipe
description: Base.prototype.pipe - prototype for streams

name: valid
description: Base.prototype.valid - checks if a given value is valid in desired format using the implemented method parse(), ignoring any exception

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} wether or not the given data is a valid format

params.name: options
params.description: any option accepted for the implemented method parse()

return.description: wether or not the given data is a valid format

name: pipeParse
description: Base.prototype.pipeParse - prototype for streams

name: pipeStringify
description: Base.prototype.pipeStringify - prototype for streams

name: src/strategies/Csv.js
Csv
description: Csv - Support for CSV filetype

name: parse
description: Csv.prototype.parse - receives an CSV string and returns valid JS

params.name: options.headers
params.description: If should parse first line as the headers, default is true

params.name: options.delimiter
params.description: Which delimiters to use when parsing, defaults to comma `,`

params.name: options.skipLines
params.description: How many lines it should skip before parsing, defaults to 1

params.name: options.offset
params.description: How many lines it should parse, defaults to -1

name: stringify
description: Csv.prototype.stringify - receives * valid JS data and returns it as CSV

params.name: options.headers
params.description: If should set first line as the headers, default is true

params.name: options.columns
params.description: Custom column mapping, see examples for more

name: src/strategies/Json.js
Json
description: Json - Support for JSON filetype

name: parse
description: Json.prototype.parse - receives an JSON string and returns valid JS

throws.description: In case the JSON string is not valid, ParserError will be thrown

name: stringify
description: Json.prototype.stringify - receives * valid JS data and returns it as JSON

name: pipeStringify
description: Json.prototype.pipeStringify - helps to stream object or array into JSON valid data

params.name: config
params.description: sets config for stream

params.name: config.type
params.description: which type of data you're streaming, defaults do array

name: pipeParse
description: Json.prototype.pipeStringify - helps to stream JSON data to JS

params.name: config
params.description: sets config for stream

params.name: config.path
params.description: select which data path to be parsed from JSON to JS

name: src/strategies/Xml/XmlTag.js
src/strategies/Xml/index.js
Xml
description: Xml - Support for XML filetype

name: setXmlDeclaration
description: Xml.prototype.setXmlDeclaration - sets XML declaration tag on first position of array or object

params.name: data
params.description: input data

name: stringify
description: Xml.prototype.stringify - receives * valid JS data and returns it as XML

params.name: options
params.description: options for turning JS data into XML

params.name: options.ignoreDeclaration
params.description: don't output XML version tag, default is true

name: parse
description: Xml.prototype.parse - receives an XML string and translate it to valid JavaScript

params.name: options.showDeclaration
params.description: force parsing XML declaration tag

params.name: options.verbose
params.description: makes xml2js return non compact mode, defaults to false

params.name: options.experimentalXmlTag
params.description: use experimental XmlTag prototype, default is false

name: toXmlTag
description: Xml.prototype.toXmlTag - turns xml2js non-compact result into XmlTag and XmlResult

name: pipeParse
description: Xml.prototype.pipeParse - stream

name: src/strategies/Yaml.js
Yaml
description: Yaml - Support for YAML filetype

name: stringify
description: Yaml.prototype.stringify - receives * valid JS data and returns it as YAML

params.name: options
params.description: options for turning JS data into YAML

name: parse
description: Yaml.prototype.parse - receives an YAML string and translate it to valid JavaScript

unknown.tagValue: {object} Parsed YAML data as JS object

return.description: Parsed YAML data as JS object

name: src/strategies/index.js
./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "parserblade",
  "version": "1.1.1",
  "description": "The easiest parser for JSON, XML, CSV and YAML. Use it as simple as JSON.stringify() or JSON.parse(). All in one place.",
  "homepage": "https://onhernandes.github.io/parserblade",
  "author": {
    "name": "Matheus Hernandes",
    "email": "",
    "url": "onhernandes.github.io"
  },
  "files": [
    "src"
  ],
  "main": "src/index.js",
  "keywords": [
    "parser",
    "data-parser",
    "csv-parser",
    "csv-stringify",
    "transform-csv",
    "csv",
    "yaml-parser",
    "yaml-stringify",
    "transform-yaml",
    "yaml",
    "xml-parser",
    "xml-stringify",
    "transform-xml",
    "xml",
    "json",
    "json-parser"
  ],
  "devDependencies": {
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-inject-style-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^7.4.0",
    "eslint-config-standard": "^14.1.1",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.22.0",
    "eslint-plugin-node": "^11.1.0",
    "eslint-plugin-promise": "^4.2.1",
    "eslint-plugin-standard": "^4.0.1",
    "husky": "^3.0.9",
    "jest": "^26.1.0",
    "lint-staged": "^9.4.3"
  },
  "engines": {
    "npm": ">= 4.0.0"
  },
  "lint-staged": {
    "*.js": [
      "eslint --fix",
      "git add"
    ]
  },
  "husky": {
    "hooks": {
      "pre-commit": "lint-staged"
    }
  },
  "scripts": {
    "test": "./node_modules/.bin/jest --no-cache",
    "tdd": "./node_modules/.bin/jest --watch --no-cache",
    "docs": "./node_modules/.bin/esdoc",
    "lint": "./node_modules/.bin/eslint",
    "publish-docs": "./node_modules/.bin/esdoc && git subtree push --prefix docs origin gh-pages",
    "tarfile": "tar -czvf parserblade.tar.gz LICENSE package* README.md src"
  },
  "repository": "git@github.com:onhernandes/parserblade.git",
  "jest": {
    "testEnvironment": "node"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "dependencies": {
    "JSONStream": "^1.3.5",
    "csv-parse": "^4.11.1",
    "csv-stringify": "^5.5.0",
    "js-yaml": "^3.14.0",
    "node-xml-stream": "^1.0.2",
    "xml-js": "^1.6.11"
  }
}
